txt.en: 'This stranger has come and brought word that my husband, your Thane, has gone missing.'
'We are behind on news of the Mark since our trade routes fell away.'
'Our guest brings word that the Fords of Isen have fallen.'
'The lords who held them -- Erkenbrand, Elfhelm, and our own Grimbold....'
'My Grimbold is loved by all, you know.'
'...are missing. None have heard from them.'
'Dear me, my son has been away so long. How I miss him!'
'Marton, our neighbouring town, is destroyed, and much of the Westfold is in ruin.'
'Our king braces for war in the Hornburg, and Gandalf Grayhame searches high and low for Grimbold and the others.'
'Erkenbrand himself took my dear boy under his wing. A good man, Erkenbrand.'
'We will not sit idly while the Westfold falls! We shall search for Grimbold and the others as well!'
'The fords were lost, but surely it was Elfhelm's fault. He and Grimbold had a falling out.'
'I shall send my four swiftest riders out in every direction to look for him in the Westfold.'
'How many mothers like me wait for their dear sons to come home from the war? How many will wait forever?'
'Are you sure that is wise, my lady? It is a death sentence to ride out now!'
'I miss my sweet son. He is a just Thane and a great warrior.'
'Hildith is not kind to Grimbold, you know. She drives him away with her hard words.'
'My son's wife has never shown me any great kindness. She is as quarrelsome a woman as ever was....'
'Don't mind me! An old woman may ramble when a visitor comes calling.'
'I advise you to look to our defences, or our escape, and waste not a man or horse on anything else.'
'Are you questioning me, Dunward?'
Cúthsig
'No indeed, Lady Hildith! It is just that... if Grimbold were here, he --'
'Speak against me again, Dunward, and I will send you from Grimslade.'
'But Grimbold is decidedly not here.'
'My word is law in Grimbold's absence.'
'I do not like that fact any more than you do...which is why we must find him.'
'My... my apologies, Lady Hildith. I only wished to offer my humble counsel.'
'Riders! Did you not hear my command?'
'Wait! Don't go just yet!'
'Return to me when you have news of Grimbold.'
Winmar
Húnbrit
Ordgar
